host.description: This is the Emarsys API server

info.description:
Manage the lifecycle of your email campaigns.
Preview, test, launch and stop an email campaign as well as get the results of the analyses.
info.title: SAP Emarsys Core - Email Campaign Lifecycle

externalDocs.description: For more information, please visit our official SAP Emarsys developer portal.

x-sap-shortText: Follow the lifecycle of your email campaigns end-to-end.

post.description: Returns the HTML, plain text or mobile version of the email.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

version.description: The content type of the response.

post.description:
Sends a test email to the specified recipient list, segment, or contact list. Recipient list types cannot be combined.

**Note:** The number of recipients must be less than 50. Additional recipients are ignored.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

recipientlist.description:
The list of recipient email addresses. Multiple values are allowed, separated by a comma without whitespace.

**Note:** Provide either a `recipientlist`, `filter_id` or `contactlist_id`. Do not combine.

filter_id.description:
The identifier of the recipient segment. Multiple values are allowed, separated by a comma without whitespace.

**Note:** Provide either a `recipientlist`, `filter_id` or `contactlist_id`. Do not combine.

contactlist_id.description:
The identifier of the recipient contact list. Multiple values are allowed, separated by a comma without whitespace.

**Note:** Provide either a `recipientlist`, `filter_id` or `contactlist_id`. Do not combine.

post.description:
Initiates the launch of an existing email campaign. The actual launch takes place once the request is processed.

This endpoint launches a campaign to receipients already in the Emarsys contact database. If the contacts are not imported yet (virtual contacts), use the Launch an Email Campaign to Virtual Contacts (Broadcast) endpoint instead.

**Important:** This is an asynchronous operation, and may take a couple of minutes to complete. The request initiates a background job and returns an identifier. Poll the Get Email Campaign Data endpoint to track the launch progress. Check the `api_status` and `api_error` parameters for the current status.

**Tip:** Configure the recipient segment or contact list using the Create an Email Campaign endpoint.

**Note:** A successful launch request may result in a failed launch, if the campaign is not properly configured. For example, a missing email subject or unspecified recipient list prevents a launch.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

schedule.description:
If specified, the launch is scheduled for the provided date and time of the custumer's default timezone.

**Accepted format:** YYYY-MM-DD HH-SS

timezone.description:
Applies the specified timezone to the launch time in the `schedule` parameter.

For the list of supported timezones, see [Timezones](docs/appendix/timezones.md).

features.description:
Specifies additional features for the email campaign.

Accepted values:
- `sto`: [Send Time Optimization](https://help.emarsys.com/hc/en-us/articles/115004470785-Send-Time-Optimization-Overview)

If any of the listed features are not available, contact Emarsys support.

post.summary: Launch an Email Campaign to Virtual Contacts (Broadcast)
post.description:
Launches an email campaign to contacts who are not in the Emarsys contact database (virtual contacts).

**Important:** Because no personalization data is available for virtual contacts, the email address and all personalization data must be provided in the payload of the request.

**Note:** You can launch a campaign to a single contact on this endpoint at a time.

email.description: The email address of the contact not in the Emarsys database.

data.description: The personalization data for the campaign.

global.description: A functional object for *Broadcast* type emails. Include the payload under this object.

post.description:
Stops an exiting email campaign, depending on its type.
- Deactivates **triggered email campaigns**. Until the campaign is reactivated, any associated events are ignored and the campaign is not launched. For details and on-event mail stream statuses, see [Triggered Email User Guide](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/f8e2fafeea804018a954a8857d9dfff3/fdec9cdb74c110149fdfb21a28afa1a1.html?q=triggered+email#the-mail-streams-tab).
- Aborts or unschedules **transactional campaigns**. Aborted campaigns cannot be rescheduled, while unscheduled ones revert to *In Design* status.

**Note:** Already launched campaigns used in an Automation Center program cannot be stopped.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

post.description: Returns the delivery status of an email campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

id.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

bounce_reason.description: The bounce type. For details, see [Bounce Management](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/f8e2fafeea804018a954a8857d9dfff3/fded35fa74c1101492a183d3fdede785.html#bounce-types).

status.description: The status of the campaign. For details, see [Email status and error codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/0d03290b9ddcc-email-status-and-error-codes).

emailId.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

launchId.description:
The identifier of the launch.

**Note:** This parameter is mandatory if the campaign has multiple launches.

lastId.description: `lastid` helps you with the pagination of the results. You get next page of data that comes *after* `lastid` in the resultset. The piece of data `lastid` refers to is *not* included.

allowNotFinished.description:
It can be used to get the delivery status for active on-event campaigns (unfinished launches).

**Note:** When used with unfinished campaigns, this parameter should be set to `true`, otherwise the call results in a `400` error .

post.summary: Query Email Response Metrics and Deliverability
post.description:
Returns a list of contacts based on the requested response metrics or deliverability status. For example, it queries all contacts in the specified campaign who opened emails in the specified timeframe.

For more information about response metrics and deliverability, see [Email Response Metrics Explained](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/f8e2fafeea804018a954a8857d9dfff3/fdec830974c1101483f1c2ed2e0f8416.html).

**Important:** This is an asynchronous operation, and may take a couple of minutes to complete. The request initiates a background job and returns an identifier. Start polling the [Get email response metric and deliverability results](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/o9dstgv1st0v6-get-email-response-metrics-and-deliverability-results) endpoint **within two minutes** using the returned query identifier for metrics and deliverability data.

**Note:** This endpoint is rate limited and accepts only one request per minute.

**Note:** The start and end date values added to the query respect the accounts' timezone. This means that account timezone is taken into account in the response data. 

**Important:** When specifying a period of certain days, use the zero hour of the day after the last one as an end date. One calendar day is the following:

` "start_date": "2021-06-19 00:00" 
"end_date": "2021-06-20 00:00" `

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

id.description: The query identifier. Use it on the  [Get Email Response Metrics and Deliverability Results](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/o9dstgv1st0v6-get-email-response-metrics-and-deliverability-results) endpoint to acquire the results.

type.description: The response metric type. For details, see [Email Response Metrics Explained](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/f8e2fafeea804018a954a8857d9dfff3/fdec830974c1101483f1c2ed2e0f8416.html).

start_date.description:
Returns metrics from the specified date.

**Accepted format:** YYYY-MM-DD

end_date.description:
Returns metrics until the specified date.

**Accepted format:** YYYY-MM-DD>

campaign_id.description: If provided, queries a specific campaign.

get.summary: Get Email Response Metrics and Deliverability Results
get.description:
Returns a list of contacts requested on the [Query email response metrics and deliverability](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/mrfse2ox3zf7d-query-email-response-metrics-and-deliverability) endpoint.

For more information about response metrics and deliverability, see [Email Response Metrics Explained](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_EMARSYS/f8e2fafeea804018a954a8857d9dfff3/fdec830974c1101483f1c2ed2e0f8416.html).

**Note:** You must start polling this endpoint **within two minutes** from the initial request on the [Query email response metrics and deliverability](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/mrfse2ox3zf7d-query-email-response-metrics-and-deliverability) endpoint. The results are available for two hours after the initial query.

parameters.name: queryId
parameters.description: The query identifier initated on the [Query email response metrics and deliverability](reference/openapi.json/paths/~1v3~1email~1responses/post) endpoint.

get.description:
Returns the summary of the responses of a launched, paused, activated or deactivated email campaign. Acquire the necessary contact identifiers on the [Get Email Response Metrics and Deliverability Results](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/o9dstgv1st0v6-get-email-response-metrics-and-deliverability-results) endpoint. > #### Important! > > Please note that this endpoint is now deprecated. It will be decommisioned in March 2026. > > We recommend using the [Bulk response summary](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/n7gmqmypxjbac-bulk-response-summary) endpoint instead. > **Important:** Due to limitations of API specification languages, dynamic keys are not yet supported in query strings on the interactive demo page (**Try it out**). We are working on this issue.

**Tip:** You can use the [Postman Collection](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/emartech/developer-hub-public-assets/master/resources/Emarsysv3PostmanCollection.json) to test the endpoint.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns results until the specified date.  Accepted formats: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM, YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Returns results from the specified date.  Accepted formats: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM, YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: launch_id
parameters.description: The identifier of the campaign launch.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

sent.description: The number of emails already sent from our servers.

planned.description: The total number of contacts assigned to the launch.

soft_bounces.description: The number of emails returned to sender due to temporary problems.

hard_bounces.description: The number of emails returned to sender due to permanent problems.

block_bounces.description: The number of emails returned to sender due to being blocked by spam filters.

opened.description:
The number of emails opened by recipients. 

**Note:** Tracks only HTML emails where images were displayed to the recipient.

unsubscribe.description: The number of clicks on the unsubscribe link.

total_clicks.description: The number of total clicks on links tracked by the Emarsys application. Counts multiple clicks per contact.

unique_clicks.description: The number of unique clicks on links tracked by the Emarsys application. Counts only a single click per contact.

complained.description: The number of recipients who marked the email as spam in their email client.

launches.description:
The number of launches in the given time range. If `launch_id` and dates are also provided:
- Returns the number of launches with the provided identifier (if the table contains identifiers)
- Returns the number of launches between the provided dates (if the table contains dates)

get.description: Returns the email behavior metrics of email campaigns in the given period.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Returns results until the specified date.  Accepted formats: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM, YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Returns results from the specified date.  Accepted formats: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS, YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM, YYYY-MM-DD

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

id.description: The unique indentifier of the object.

campaign_category.description: The name of the campaign category.

parent_campaign_id.description: The identifier of the parent campaign.

parent_campaign_name.description: The name of the parent campaign.

program_id.description: The identifier of the used program.

type.description: The type of the campaing's channel.

version_name.description: The name of the campaign's version.

is_final.description: The launch is not a test.

start.description: The Unix timestamp of the launch's start.

sent.description: The number of emails already sent from our servers.

canceled.description: The number of emails that were not sent due to error.

opened.description: The number of emails opened by the receipients.

clicked.description: The number of emails clicked by recipients.

clicked_anonymous.description: The number of emails anonymously clicked by recipients.

bounced_block.description: The number of emails returned to sender due to being blocked by spam filters.

bounced_hard.description: The number of emails returned to sender due to permanent problems.

bounced_soft.description: The number of emails returned to sender due to temporary problems.

complained.description: The number of recipients who marked the email as spam in their email client.

unsubscribed.description: The number of clicks on the unsubscribe link.

mobile_clicked.description: The number of emails clicked on a mobile device by recipients.

mobile_opened.description: The number of emails opened on a mobile device by recipients.

privacy_opened.description: The number of emails opened automatically by recipients.

purchased.description: The number of purchases attributed to the campaign.

revenue.description: The amount of revenue generated by the campaign.

post.description: Lists all launches of an email campaign, including the launch identifier, date, and status of each individual launch.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

emailId.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

get.description: Returns the list of email personalization fields with alternative values, and shows if personalization is omitted.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

element.description: The field number of the personalized elements.

defaultValue.description: Alternative values specified for the personalization fields.

post.summary: Get the URL of a Launched Email Campaign Content
post.description:
Returns the URL of a launched email campaignâ€™s content for the specified contact.

This endpoint **does not work** for deleted campaigns, it returns the http error `400 6003`. However, **deactivated** campaigns can still be queried.

parameters.name: emailId
parameters.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

url.description: The URL of the online version.

key_id.description: Identifies the contact by their `id`, `uid`, or the name/integer id of a custom field, such as `email`.

key_value.description: The value of the key identifier (`key_id`).

launchListId.description: Identifies different lauches of the very same campaign. Using this you can differentiate and retrieve the specific online version URL of the same event campaign but for a different launch.

post.summary: Unsubscribe a Contact from an Email Campaign
post.description: Registers an unsubscribe event to remove the specified contact from an email campaign. Think of this as merely registering a request, no other acion is taken, the removal is not done yet. Use the [Update contacts](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-api/b3A6MjQ4OTk4MTE) endpoint to perform the actual unsubscribe.

launch_list_id.description:
The identifier of contacts who clicked the unsubscribe link.

| Email Type | Data Availability |
| --- | --- |
| Batch email | Two months |
| On-event email | No time limit |

email_id.description: The identifier of the email campaign.

contact_uid.description: The contact identifier (`uid`). For details about contact identifiers, [concepts](docs/before-you-start/concepts.md).

default-response-example.title: Default response

replyCode.description: The Emarsys response code. Successful requests return 0; otherwise, see [errors](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/jir98la21pufy-http-400-errors).

replyText.description: Additional information on the status of the request.

data.description: Contains the requested data, if applicable.

default-response-example.description: This is the generic SAP Emarsys response.

oauth2ClientCredentials.description: To use this API, you must first obtain an OAuth 2.0 client credentials token. After that you can use the token to call the API. For more information, see [Authentication](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/branches/OAuth-2.0/b3c3a1eba8515-authentication-in-v3-api).
